fotoshop.Filter

Class MonoFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • fotoshop.Filter.Filter
      • fotoshop.Filter.MonoFilter

  • public class MonoFilter
extends Filter
    Derived from the suggestions made in "Objects First with Java" by Michael Kolling and David Barnes, along with the methods used originally within the Editor class of the prototype Fotoshop project. * @author Benjamin Nicholls
    MonoFilter applies a monochrome effect to the image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MonoFilter(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name of the filter via the super

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ColorImage applyFilter(ColorImage image)
      apply the MonoFilter, making the target image monochrome
      ColorImage applyFilter(ColorImage image, float i)
      Default applyFilter method, calls the applyFilter method.

      • MonoFilter

    • Method Detail

      • applyFilter

        public ColorImage applyFilter(ColorImage image)
        apply the MonoFilter, making the target image monochrome
        Overrides:
        applyFilter in class Filter
        Parameters:
        image - the image for the filter to be applied to.
        Returns:
        imageOut return a monochrome duplicate of the parameter image

      • applyFilter

        public ColorImage applyFilter(ColorImage image,
                     float i)
        Default applyFilter method, calls the applyFilter method.
        Overrides:
        applyFilter in class Filter
        Parameters:
        image - The ColorImage image to apply the filter to
        i - May be 0 value, has no effect in this filter
        Returns:
        The monochrome version of the input image
